channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: Find Your Favorites: Thursday's Entries — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
As we round the corner on the end of the third week of our Bedroom Contest, we have eleven more new entries for your viewing (and voting) pleasure. Check out today's new entries and if you like what you see, be sure to click the heart on their post to make them a "favorite" and help move them up on the leaderboard.

  • Sacha's Black & White Bedroom
  • Angela's Nature Inspired Bedroom
  • Annie's Beach House Bedroom
  • Kellie's Place for Everything Bedroom
  • Debra's Jewel Box Bedroom
  • Laura's Wonderful Belongings Bedroom
  • Carolyn's Decorative Details Bedroom
  • Lisl's Home Office Bedroom
  • Melanie's Little Loft Bedroom
  • Desiree's Soft Industrial Bedroom
  • Meagan's Cozy Cocoon Bedroom

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Meagan's Cozy Cocoon Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Meagan
Location:
Brooklyn, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My bedroom is my cocoon. I love the way it feels cozy and warm at night and refreshing and bright in the morning.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Desiree's Soft Industrial Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Desiree
Location:
Amsterdam Netherlands
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the airy feel of it. It is overall white but I have left a piece of the original concrete wall in sight. This gives the room a soft industrial touch that I truly love. I have a locker to store jeans and t shirts and some other things I do not wear very often. On the inside of the doors I added fashion images for inspiration. I love them so much that I often keep one door half open. The colors in my bedroom are mostly black and white with a gray floor ... I add color with different bedspreads and cushions.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Melanie's Little Loft Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Melanie
Location:
Montreal Canada
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the high ceilings, large windows and the mainly white color palette with pops of turquoise...it feels calming, airy and happy!


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Lisl's Home Office Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!

What do you love about your bedroom?:
My bedroom is by far the brightest room in my apartment so it definitely feels like a retreat.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: A Creole Country House on the Bayou — Garden & Gun
item.description:
When I was little girl growing up in south Louisiana, my mother would take me on tours of the beautiful old plantation houses in the countryside outside Lafayette. It was the beginning of a lifelong fascination with architecture in general, and Southern vernacular architecture in particular. So when I saw this 200-year-old Creole manor in the pages of Garden & Gun, it brought me right back to my roots. 

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Amy Pigliacampo's Home Office + Studio — Workspace Tour
item.description:
Name: Amy Pigliacampo
Location: Echo Park, Los Angeles, California
Size: 264 square feet

Last week we got a full tour of Amy Pigliacampo and her husband Corey Szopinski's home in Echo Park. One of the standout features was their organization, which remained stylish, but super functional. Amy's office, which is both her work studio and closet, is an incredible example of this streamlined collectedness. 

More
item.author: Bethany Nauert

item.title: Shop the Set: The Americans
item.description:
The Americans is a new television drama that is bringing an not-currently-in-favor era back into style with mustard yellow and high wasted jeans. The early 1980’s style of the kitchen in The Americans is bringing back wood paneling and Harvest Gold appliances, but there is a modern way to get the early 80’s look without the formica. 

More
item.author: Claire Bock

item.title: Carolyn's Decorative Details Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Carolyn
Location:
Hoboken, NJ
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the high ceiling and stature of our bedroom. I also love the original woodwork and period details in the crown moldings, ceiling medallion, fireplace, pocket doors with etched glass, parlor mirror and window shutters.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Don't-Miss Beautiful Bedrooms: Week Three — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
As we near the end of week three of the My Bedroom Retreat contest we're just about to tip over into the triple digits in terms of entries posted - over 100 different bedroom designs to discover! Our talented readers have filled the entry inbox with amazing rooms and design savvy to spare.  Here's a peek at some of the stylish entries from this past week...

More
item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: Laura's Wonderful Belongings Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Laura
Location:
Vancouver, WA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My bedroom is so comfortable. The bed is a dream and every item in the room is useful or has a wonderful memory. The heart collage of photos is one of my favorite elements. I found the heart frame on the street and filled it full of the people I love.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Need to Charge Your Phone Fast? Switch to Airplane Mode
item.description: C'mon! Just fifteen more minutes! That's all you need to get out the door. But your phone's battery dropped dead, and there's not enough time to get a decent charge. If you ever find yourself in these dire straits, try this stupid-simple tip to keep the juice flowing fast. More
item.author: Taryn Fiol

item.title: Getting a Fresh Perspective: How I Learned to Love an Eyesore
item.description:
As most of you probably know, co-habitating often calls for compromise.  For months I’ve been living with a huge, mass-produced canvas decorating my living room, silently wondering why my style-savvy boyfriend would hang such a thing. Well, I finally brought it up, and I’ve completely changed my mind.  What caused my 180? 

More
item.author: Jennifer Hunter

item.title: 9 Other Ways to Use Aluminum Foil Around the House — Real Simple
item.description:
I love this idea! As soon as I saw the photo I had one of those "how did I live this long without knowing this!?" moments. 

Real Simple has a collection of other, possibly-new-to-you uses for aluminum foil, an item that I'm fairly sure the majority of us has a roll of in the ktichen cabinet. The best little tips and tricks are the ones you can use in a pinch and on the fly, and these definitely apply. 

Click thorough for all the links:

More
item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: Debra's Jewel Box Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Debra
Location:
New York, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My bedroom is like a tiny jewel box. It's actually the biggest and brightest room in my very small apartment, and was a key selling point in an otherwise light challenged space. Many people advised against painting a small room dark blue, including my painter, and I almost chickened out. But it was the best decision I made...the bermuda blue walls play off the amazing New York City skyline outside my window. The room glows, and is both dazzling and calming at the same time.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: 10 Boldly Patterned Chairs Under $1000
item.description: Boldly patterned chairs make such bright, beautiful statements in a room. They don't require the commitment of paint on a wall or the investment of a whole sofa, yet one little piece can add a big pop of color. Here are our favorite picks, all for under $1000. More
item.author: Linda Ly

item.title: We're Hiring: Office Manager/Personal Assistant — Apartment Therapy Job Openings
item.description:
We're looking for a full time Office Manager/Personal Assistant to join our team in New York City. You should be excited about working at a start up, enthusiastic about home design and Apartment Therapy's mission. Read on for more info:


More
item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: A Work-From-Home Mini Manifesto
item.description: As an Apartment Therapy contributor and design addict, I'm pretty sensitive to my living and working environments. Right around the time Yahoo's Marissa Mayer banned employees working from home, I was asking my boss if I could work from home a couple of days a week. More
item.author: Theresa Gonzalez

item.title: Dryer Survivors: What To Make with Leftover Socks
item.description:
It's a cliche at this point: the dryer ate one of your socks and now the singleton loiters around your laundry room. Although you've given up the hope that its mate with turn up, it kills you to throw it away. Here are a few ways to put leftover socks to good use around the house, from toys to cleaning supplies.

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Claire & Jeffrey's Kitchen: Taking Care of the Basics — Renovation Diary
item.description:
Jeffrey tests the brackets he's attached to the studs for the future wood slab floating shelf.  

Name: Claire & Jeffrey
Type of Project: Kitchen remodel
Location: Minneapolis, Minnesota
Type of building: Single-family bungalow, 950 square feet

The Renovation Diaries are a new collaboration with our community in which we feature your step by step renovation progress and provide monetary support towards getting it done in style.

This week we wait for all the boring, not-visually-transformative stuff to be resolved. Electric, plumbing, heating. It's hard on me because I want to see more "progress". This is progress, yes, but I don't understand how it all works and there's nothing I can do to help, so I'm not jumping for joy.

More
item.author: Guest

item.title: The Duplex, Left Side: Jared & Chika's Colorful Nest — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Chika Eustace & Jared Randall + 8 month old Lisle Randall
Location: Ballard, Seattle, Washington
Size: 850 square feet (living) + 500 square feet (basement studio) 
Years lived in: 5 years; owned (co-owned)

On the left side of a cozy little duplex in Ballard (the tour of the other half is coming up next week), Chika Eustace and her husband Jared Randall live with their son Lisle in a colorful and creative space. The duplex (sweetly referred to as "The Dupe") is co-owned by Chika and Jared, along with Chika's business partner Jean and her fiance, Dylan. Chika and Jean own R&L Goods, a textiles and accessories company, and the two couples have found a serene and productive way to combine work and life.

More
item.author: Andie Powers

item.title: Carved Wood: Chair, Chests & Tables — The Thursday Afternoon Scavenger
item.description:
Here it's all about the details; this furniture is functional, beautiful and interesting.
  • Brooklyn, NY: Victorian Carved Chair - $125
  • Lisle, IL: Indian Chest - $300
  • Washington, DC: Wood Candlesticks - $80
  • New York, NY: Bachelor's Chest - $535
  • New York, NY: Mitchell & Gold Side Table - $50

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Kellie's Place for Everything Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Kellie
Location:
Cleveland, TN
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
It's clean and simple. I have always wanted an all white room and now I have it! Since it's so simple, I love the pattern that the duvet brings and the color from the shelf of books. It is a small room with a large window and it always feels bright and cheerful to me when I wake up in the morning.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Disappearing Packaging Imagined for Popular Products — Design News 03.21.13
item.description:
Less packaging means less waste. Designer Aaron Mickelson recreated how five brands might abandon packaging entirely in his thesis project. Glad trash bags are rolled and pulled from the center like they are in its box, but Mickelson just prints the branding on the outer bag, Oxo storage containers have ink that washes off, and Nivea's soap box dissolves in the shower. 

In other news, Google launches note app Keep, and check out a 3D house that makes more 3D houses. See the headlines after the jump.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: Annie's Beach House Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Annie
Location:
Barrington, RI
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that our bedroom feels bright, and at the same time calm. Our home was built about 100 years ago as a summer beach house with old pine for floors and tongue and groove beamed ceilings. There is an open knothole by the door that has frequently been used by our daughter to drop notes through to the kitchen. I love the grapevine we’ve collected and that the posts of our bed were made from trees we collected when a friend’s farm was clearing land.


More
item.author: Jason Loper
